subject: RE: [junit] Is there a way to raise an error and not a fail?
msgSnippet: Jeff, If I understand your questions correctly, you are trying to do something as follows: public void testLogWithRecordIsNull() throws AuditException { record
messageBody:
Jeff,

If I understand your questions correctly, you are trying to do something as
follows:

public void testLogWithRecordIsNull() throws AuditException {
record = null;
UUID key = CONTEXT_OP_KEY;
AuditLogger subjectAuditLogger = new
AuditLogger(AUDIT_CATAGORY,
contextParent, key);
try {
subjectAuditLogger.log(record);
} catch (AuditException ae) {
// System.out.println("AuditException Message: " +
ae.getMessage());
assertEquals(
"Illegal argument: null audit record
used to submit an audit event",//$NON-NLS-1$
ae.getMessage());
}

}

Hope this helps.

-Kamal.

-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Jeff
Schlaver
Sent: Tuesday, June 06, 2006 3:29 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Is there a way to raise an error and not a fail?

I have come across a situation that the data has a problem. I was
trying to come up with a way to have the test pass but still raise an
error. The other option is to some how get it to appear in the
test-reports.

Thanks
Jeff
